overview_of_class: The course will provide students with a working knowledge of the fundamentals of screenwriting. Students will learn how core concepts of character, structure, plot, theme, and tone work together on the page to create narrative. Students will explore these concepts and their practice in film, as well as how they might utilize these concepts to express their personal voice and vision.
name: Foundations of Screenwriting
title: SoC RTVF 260-0-20 Foundations of Screenwriting

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: The course will provide students with a working knowledge of the fundamentals of screenwriting. Students will learn how core concepts of character, structure, plot, theme, and tone work together on the page to create narrative. Students will explore these concepts and their practice in film, as well as how they might utilize these concepts to express their personal voice and vision.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: Students will work on writing and research assignments that will cultivate in the completion of multiple polished short screenplays.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Lecture, reading assignments, discussion, in-class screenings, and in-class workshop of student assignments.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Screenplays will be graded on their ability to creatively and effectively convey narrative, as well as professionalism.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
Writing Short Films: Structure and Content for Screenwriters (2nd Ed.),
by Linda Cowgill, Los Angeles: Lone Eagle (2005).
